glossentry.glossdef: The N28 interface is defined in the 3GPP standard 29.594. Currently, the NCC provides Charging (in the NCC CNF context) support for the 5G Nchf_SpendingLimitControl (N28) PCF-CHF interface.
The N40 Reference point is between SMF and CHF and is defined in TS 32.240 to enable online and offline charging.
The Npcf uses the N7 interface (for policy only) which is equivalent to the Gx interface in 4G environments and is defined in 3GPPv15.0.0 TS29.512.
The Network Access Identifier is a standard way of identifying the request of the subscriber to access the network.
Network Access Server provides remote or wired access to a network to the subscribed users.

A node is a worker machine in Kubernetes. A node may be a VM or physical machine, depending on the cluster. Each node contains the services necessary to run pods and is managed by the master components.
Network Repository Function is a network entity in the 5G core network
